results.title: Volatile substances
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Single Concept Drug Films”
Informational film on the hazards associated with the abuse of common domestic and industrial chemicals: solvents, aerosol propellants, and anaesthetics. Alludes briefly to the injury which can result from the toxicity of these chemicals - permanent impairment of motor function and acute organ pathology. Directed more towards adult caregivers than the children and adolescents who are more likely to abuse these substances.

results.title: Sedatives
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Single Concept Drug Films”

One of a series of drug films which explains the uses of sedatives and effects on the individual’s personality. Looks at tolerance and physical and psychological dependence.

results.title: Marijuana
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Single Concept Drug Films”.
Explains the sources and effects of marihuana on the individual personality, admitting that science has not yet fully researched the drug.

results.title: Pulleys
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Simple Machines”.
Illustrates a simple machine and, by explaining the principle of its operation, shows how pulleys make possible the lifting of heavy loads with a minimum of effort. Both the fixed pulleys , which changes the direction of force and the moveable pulleys which multiply force are examined in detail along with the block and tackle system. Shows the functions of different kinds if pulleys as they are seen in everyday use.

results.title: Inclined planes
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Simple Machines”.
Presents the principle of the inclined plane, including the screw and wedge. Shows how an inclined plane or slope facilitates the moving of heavy objects. Demonstrates the everyday use of the inclined plane and explains that such simple machines as screws and wedges are used when it is desirable to trade distance for force.

results.title: Simple Machines

results.title: Wheels and axles
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Simple Machines”.
Illustrates the force and distance relationships which exist in machines, utilizing the principles of the wheel and exle. The way in which the working wheels of a bicycle increase force or distance is analysed and visually demonstrated, and the film examines such applications of the wheel and axle as the gear drive, belt drive and crank.

results.title: Levers
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Simple Machines”.
Introduces the concept that the lever is a simple machine which can change the amount of force and distance. Shows such familiar forms of the lever as a see-saw, nutcracker, and broom and examples of more complex machines.
